text: DEFINITION 2.13 A pushdown automaton is a 6-tuple (Q, %, T4, 40, F), where Q, Y, T, and F are all finite sets, and 1. Q is the set of states, 2. Y is the input alphabet, 3. T is the stack alphabet, 4. 3: Q x Y. x .—P(Q x Tz) is the transition function, 5. qo € Q is the start state, and 6. F C Q is the set of accept states.
